channel.title: Cannot connect to my own server
channel.description:
Hey guys, well i am a coder and want to start my own server.. i started with nexus 718 source, and it said to use matrix client so i did.. and i changed ip to 0.0.0.0, 127.0.0.1 "localhost" and "" .. why cant i connect to my server? this is what the source cmd says:
starting... [Launcher] Initing Cache... [Launcher] Initing Data Files... [Launcher] Initing Fishing Spots... [Launcher] Initing NPC Combat Scripts... [Launcher] Initing Dialogues... [Launcher] Initing Controlers... [Launcher] Initing Cutscenes... [Launcher] Initing Friend Chats Manager... [Launcher] Initing Cores Manager... [Launcher] Initing World... [Launcher] Initing Region Builder... [Launcher] Initing Server Channel Handler... [Region] Missing xteas for region 7503. [Region] Missing xteas for region 7759. [Launcher] Server took 1904 milli seconds to launch. [Launcher] Hosting this server at www.play-core.net76.net!
and the client remains at: checking for updates 1%
Add me on skype if you can help! Jeremy.fitzgerald5

item.title: Cannot connect to my own server
item.dc:creator: @bgblanchette bgblanchette
item.description:
@bgblanchette wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:6, topic:465751”]Generally, this problem is a client sided problem. Your server is running but your client is having problems finding the cache, giving the freezing at one percent problem. It’s a common problem just make sure your cache is in the correct place and make sure it’s set up correctly. Seeing that it’s a 718, you’re going to want to have a copy of the cache in the server directory, not jus the client.[/quote] I’m trying to go on nexus’s source with the zenith client, my friend did id allready on his comp… i can open the client with the zenith source running but not with my nexus source running…

Read full topic
item.source: Cannot connect to my own server

item.title: Cannot connect to my own server
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Generally, this problem is a client sided problem. Your server is running but your client is having problems finding the cache, giving the freezing at one percent problem. It’s a common problem just make sure your cache is in the correct place and make sure it’s set up correctly. Seeing that it’s a 718, you’re going to want to have a copy of the cache in the server directory, not jus the client.

Read full topic
item.source: Cannot connect to my own server
